intro: Falcaria falcarioides, commonly known as the creeping knotweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender,匍匐 (creeping) stems that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread aggressively. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Falcaria falcarioides is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including gardens and roadside areas.
